place.name: SCAMBLESBY
place.gazetteerText: SCAMBLESBY, a parish, with a village, in Horncastle district, Lincoln; on the Wolds, 6 miles N by E of Horncastle r. station. It has a post-office under Horncastle. Acres, 2, 150. Real property, £3, 228. Pop., 471. Houses, 103. The property is subdivided. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £300. Patron, the Bishop of Lincoln. The church is good. There are chapels for Wesleyans and Primitive Methodists, and a national school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
